That sounds like a great way to spend a Saturday morning! The Garmin Forerunner 245 Music will be a perfect companion for your runs with the local group. Having music to listen to can definitely make the experience more enjoyable and help you stay motivated.

Since you'll be running with a group, you might want to consider a few things to ensure you can still hear your surroundings and stay safe:

* **Volume Control:** Make sure to keep the volume at a reasonable level so you can still hear your surroundings, including traffic, other runners, and instructions from your group leaders.
* **Audio Prompts:** Consider setting up audio prompts on your watch to alert you to important events, such as pace, distance, or heart rate zones. This way, you can stay focused on your run without having to constantly check your watch.
* **Bluetooth Headphones:** Choose Bluetooth headphones that are designed for running and provide good sound quality and fit comfortably. Some popular options include the Garmin HRM-Dual headphones, Jaybird Vista, or Plantronics BackBeat FIT.

Remember to also follow basic safety guidelines when running with music, such as:

* **Stay aware of your surroundings:** Keep an eye on the road, other runners, and potential hazards like potholes or uneven terrain.
* **Use reflective gear:** Wear reflective clothing or accessories to increase your visibility, especially if you're running early in the morning or in low-light conditions.
* **Follow traffic rules:** Obey traffic signals and signs, and always run facing traffic.

With the Garmin Forerunner 245 Music and some common-sense safety precautions, you'll be all set for a fun and enjoyable run with your group!
